trialInfo.commandoknife_hint1: Fleeing a certain distance from the <y>Elder Lemurian</c> <r>spawns reinforcements</c>.
trialInfo.commandoknife_hint2: The <y>Elder Lemurian</c> moves faster. Other enemies move slowly.
trialInfo.shield_tackle_hint: <b>Shield Tackle</c> provides <y>limited invulnerability</c> for the duration of the skill.
trialInfo.combat_slide_hint: You can jump while using <b>Tactical Slide</c>.
trialInfo.score_gives_events_hint: Different item and enemy spawns occur depending on your score.
trialInfo.experience_gain_altered: Enemies drop more experience based on how dangerous they are.
trialInfo.scavenger_hunt_hint2: The Scavenger lies beneath the starting arena.
trialInfo.loaderspider_hint: <y>Mechanical Spiders</c> are hidden in fixed locations and appear when you get close.
trialInfo.mercclone_hint: Reinforcements will continue to spawn until the initial wave is cleared.
trialInfo.mercclone_hint2: Your doppleganger won't return to battle until you clear his initial reinforcements.
trialInfo.merctower_hint: Bosses spawn near teleporters spread across the stage.
trialInfo.acridbubble_hint: <b>Toxic Bubbles</c> can be bounced on to extend your jump and be struck to reposition them.
trialInfo.huntressropes_hint: Every 5 points an item will randomly spawn.
trialInfo.handsurvivors_hint1: <y>Keycard barrels</c> spawn at certain score thresholds.
trialInfo.handmainteinance_hint: New enemies spawn at different score thresholds.
trialInfo.snipertowers_hint1: <r>Enemies increase in speed</c> based on your score.
trialInfo.snipertowers_hint2: Items spawn at different score thresholds.
trialInfo.snipertowers_hint3: <r>You are trapped</c> in the central tower.
trialInfo.drifterblock_hint1: Aiming for high corners will allow you to drop <b>Scrap Cubes</c> in precise locations.
trialInfo.drifterblock_hint2: Striking a <b>Scrap Cube</c> will reposition it.  You can strike cubes even while atop them.
trialInfo.drifterknife_hint3: Stronger Wisps spawn regularly over time.
trialInfo.banditwhip_hint: Items are <y>hidden within the walls</c> of the castle.
trialInfo.gupcount_hint1: Gup has a very small attention radius.
trialInfo.gupcount_hint2: Enemies will reset if you've entered an irrecoverable trial state.
trialInfo.meteor_hint: Enemies drop more gold based on how dangerous they are.
trialInfo.cheflem_hint: <y>Bonus Time pickups</c> spawn at regular intervals and <r>despawn after 7 seconds</c>.
trialInfo.artitower_hint: <r>You are trapped</c> in the central tower.
trialInfo.artirace_hint: <b>Tectonic Surge</c> lowers your gravity <y>until you land</c>.
trialInfo.acridrace_hint1: Lynx Totems spawn regularly across the stage.
trialInfo.pilotjuggle_hint: The trial ends when an enemy touches the ground.
trialInfo.enforcer3_hint: Certain enemies types have a chance to drop items.

trialInfo.playerDrone_hint3: Killing Vagrants spawns a group of extra targets.

trialInfo.final_hint2: Shops have <y>fixed selections</c> that <b>rotate between stages.</c>

trials.main.title: TRIALS
trials.main.commando1.name: A Colossal Feat
trials.main.commando1.desc: Defeat a horde of enemies guarding the final <y>Colossus</c>.
trials.main.commando2.name: Brave Heart, Steady Hand
trials.main.commando2.desc: Stay close and <y>defeat the Elder Lemurian</c> utilizing your <b>Combat Knife</c>. Retreating results in more reinforcements.
trials.main.commando3.name: Slide to the Finish!
trials.main.commando3.desc: Utilizing your <b>Tactical Slide</c>, <y>race to the final statue</c> to reach your goal.
trials.main.commando4.name: A Rung Above
trials.main.commando4.desc: Defeat enemies to spawn score pickups. Survive and <y>collect at least 40 points</c>.
trials.main.commando5.name: S.O.S.
trials.main.commando5.desc: Fly around the cavern and <y>shatter at least 50 targets</c> as a Drone. Enemy aggression escalates with score.
trials.main.huntress1.name: Piercing Space and Time
trials.main.huntress1.desc: <y>Climb to the teleporter</c> using <b>Warp Darts</c> in order to reach the teleporter.
trials.main.huntress2.name: A Small Army
trials.main.huntress2.desc: An overloading shrine holds 100 Tiny Imps.  <y>Defeat 60 Imps</c> utilizing your chargeable <b>Piercing Arrows</c> to secure victory.
trials.main.huntress3.name: Hot-Rope Hop
trials.main.huntress3.desc: <y>Destroy at least 10 targets</c> in the rope-filled magma cavern.
trials.main.huntress4.name: Blades in the Wind
trials.main.huntress4.desc: <y>Defeat at least 1 Toxic Beast</c>, utilizing your <b>Laser Cyclone</c> to deal consistent damage. Avoiding the returning glaive results in extended up-time.
trials.main.enforcer1.name: Specimen Sampling
trials.main.enforcer1.desc: Utilizing your <b>Shield Tackle</c>, lead the Gups to the scrapped together device. <y>You'll need at least 4 Gips worth</c> of material to secure the sample.
trials.main.enforcer2.name: Inner Demons
trials.main.enforcer2.desc: <y>Defeat your own shadows</c> as soon as possible.
trials.main.enforcer3.name: Go On Without Me
trials.main.enforcer3.desc: <y>Defeat at least 85 Lemurians</c> on the treacherous mountain.
trials.main.enforcer4.name: Scavenger Hunt
trials.main.enforcer4.desc: Collect items and drones to assist in <y>defeating the deadly Scavenger</c>. Your foe is frenzied and well equipped.
trials.main.bandit1.name: Endless Stand-Off
trials.main.bandit1.desc: <y>Defeat at least 30 opponents<y> in the desert <b>while affected by Standoff</c>. This trial ends when your <b>Standoff</c> buff wears off.
trials.main.bandit2.name: Highway Robbery
trials.main.bandit2.desc: Drop a <b>Flashbang</c> to evade detection as you scavenge as much gold as possible. Escape via the teleporter <y>with at least 700 gold</c>.
trials.main.bandit3.name: Castle of Memories
trials.main.bandit3.desc: Fight your way through the ancient temple to <y>defeat the boss</c> guarding the exit.
trials.main.acrid1.name: Caustic Climb
trials.main.acrid1.desc: Use your <b>Toxic Bubbles</c> to launch yourself out of the drowning pit. <y>Climb at least 70 meters</c> before time runs out.
trials.main.acrid2.name: A Toxic Path
trials.main.acrid2.desc: Race past hordes of enemies in the fungal cavern. <y>Finish 3 laps</c> to complete the trial.
trials.main.acrid3.name: Uncontrolled Experiment
trials.main.acrid3.desc: <y>Shatter all the targets</c> within the winding halls. <b>Dissolving Ambush</c> allows you to create puddles to warp across large gaps in the interior.
trials.main.loader1.name: Crash Landing
trials.main.loader1.desc: <y>Collect at least 40 points</c> before time runs out. Your aerial <b>Short Circuit</c> can be used to traverse the cavern quickly.
trials.main.loader2.name: Colossal Lift
trials.main.loader2.desc: In the ruins of an ancient forest <y>defeat 10 Colossi</c> as fast as you can. Revived drones can be amplified by utilizing your <b>S260 Conduit</c> skill.
trials.main.loader3.name: Ruins of the Future
trials.main.loader3.desc: <y>Crush at least 25 hiding Mechanical Spiders</c> before they can escape.
trials.main.mercenary1.name: Shadows of the Past
trials.main.mercenary1.desc: <y>Defeat your unbound shadow-clone</c> as soon as possible.
trials.main.mercenary2.name: Assassination Contract
trials.main.mercenary2.desc: <y>Defeat the 6 bosses</c> lurking near the scattered teleporters as soon as possible. Utilize <b>Skyward Assault</c> to better navigate the corridors.
trials.main.mercenary3.name: Don't Think, Feel
trials.main.mercenary3.desc: <y>Deflect at least 10 attacks</c> using <b>Focused Strike</c>. Well timed parries provide temporary invulnerability.
trials.main.hand1.name: Think of the Children
trials.main.hand1.desc: <y>Guide at least 5 Children</c> to the distant Parent. The wandering Golems contain trapped keycards.
trials.main.hand2.name: Routine Maintenance
trials.main.hand2.desc: Clean up the top of the massive bridge! Clear at least 25 invaders to fulfill programmed orders.
trials.main.hand3.name: Main Systems Offline
trials.main.hand3.desc: Fire your <b>Speed Drones</c> at the attacking invaders and <y>score at least 200 points</c>. Scoring points awards keycards and tougher enemies are worth more points.
trials.main.chef1.name: A Fresh Harvest
trials.main.chef1.desc: Defeat <y>at least 20 Lemurians</c> before time runs out. Bonus Time pickups spawn temporarily to extend the timer.
trials.main.chef2.name: Kited Blades
trials.main.chef2.desc: <y>Shatter at least 75 targets</c> before you reach the end of the underwater chasm.
trials.main.chef3.name: The Right Ingredients
trials.main.chef3.desc: <b>Cook</c> <y>at least 15 enemies</c> before time runs out. Deaths result in scoring penalties.
trials.main.artificer1.name: Lightning Strikes Twice
trials.main.artificer1.desc: <y>Pierce at least 7 Golems</c> in a row. You can repeat the input once per strike to flex the <b>Pulse Spear</c>, granting it a temporary piercing effect.
trials.main.artificer2.name: Danger Orbits
trials.main.artificer2.desc: <y>Burn at least 50 enemies</c> utilizing your <b>Localized Sun</c>. Your body movements manipulate the attack's position.
trials.main.artificer3.name: In the Clouds
trials.main.artificer3.desc: Utilizing <b>Tectonic Surge</c>, <y>race to the top of the tower</c> to reach your goal.
trials.main.sniper1.name: Bullseyes Only
trials.main.sniper1.desc: <y>Shatter 15 targets</c> in the lava filled cavern. <b>Quickscope</c> can be used to fire through walls.
trials.main.sniper2.name: Meteor Showers
trials.main.sniper2.desc: Utilize the Glowing Meteorite terminals to <y>score at least 40 points</c>. Triggering the teleporter <b>doubles your score</c>.
trials.main.sniper3.name: Lone Wolf
trials.main.sniper3.desc: <y>Defeat at least 35 foes</c> from within the outpost. Enemy speeds increase with score.
trials.main.drifter1.name: Equivalent Exchange
trials.main.drifter1.desc: <b>Recycle</c> Monster Teeth to acquire Rusty Knives. You need <y>at least 8 knives</c> before activating the teleporter.
trials.main.drifter2.name: Perilous Descent
trials.main.drifter2.desc: <y>Collect at least 100 gold</c> and <y>reach the bottom of the cave</c>. Your <b>Scrap Cubes</c> slide when struck, even while atop them. <b>Try aiming for corners</c>.
trials.main.drifter3.name: A Duplicator?!
trials.main.drifter3.desc: <y>Collect at least 100 items</c> before time expires. <b>Salvage</c> frequently summons Substandard Duplicators, which will multiplicatively improve your score.
trials.main.engineer1.name: Get Off My Lawn!
trials.main.engineer1.desc: Defend yourself from the violent plants to acquire healing items. <y>Have at least 750 health</c> when the timer runs out.
trials.main.engineer2.name: From All Angles
trials.main.engineer2.desc: Use your turrets and <b>Shockwave Mines</c> to defeat at least 50 of the encroaching enemies. If either of your turrets break down its all over.
trials.main.engineer3.name: Drowning in Research
trials.main.engineer3.desc: Defeat <y>at least 50 of the sinking enemies</c> using your <b>Mortar Barrage</c>. You will incur damage if enemies reach the bottom of the tank.
trials.main.miner1.name: Scorching Heart
trials.main.miner1.desc: Using <b>Crush</c>, charge your Heat Meter to <y>maintain</c> <b>Scorching</c> <y>for at least 40 seconds</c> in the hot volcano.
trials.main.miner2.name: Gup Sorting?
trials.main.miner2.desc: Gups, Geeps and Gips each belong in different pens. It's up to you to <y>decipher where they belong</c>. Your <y>Prison Shackles</c> can assist in splitting the pack.
trials.main.miner3.name: Break the Targets!
trials.main.miner3.desc: <y>Shatter every target</c>, utilizing well placed <b>Throwing Axes</c>. Pickaxes may pass through objects while rising, and they inherit your speed when thrown.
trials.main.pilot1.name: Emergency Ejection
trials.main.pilot1.desc: <y>Glide to the bottom of the chasm</c> in your parachute, <y>collecting at least 55 points</c> on the way down.
trials.main.pilot2.name: Juggling Priorities
trials.main.pilot2.desc: Using <b>Airstrikes</c>, keep the Crab afloat for at least 25 seconds. Additionally, <c>Target Acquired</c> can be used in addition to slow its descent.
trials.main.pilot3.name: Race to the Finish!
trials.main.pilot3.desc: <y>Race to the finish</c> before time runs out. The <b>Aerobatic</c> dash clings to walls, allowing you to scale them for a time.
trials.main.final.name: Judgement
trials.main.final.desc: <y>Defeat all that stand before you</c> to reach the <b>final throne.</c>

options.fullscreen.desc: Whether or not the game is running in fullscreen rather than windowed-mode.
options.resolution.desc: The size of the game window when not running in fullscreen mode.
options.vsync.desc: Eliminates screen tearing by synchronizing the game's framerate to the monitor's refresh rate. Only enable this setting if you see screen tearing.
options.scale.desc: Determines how zoomed in the in-game camera is.
options.scale.lockTooltip: The current game resolution does not allow modifying the Zoom Scale or HUD Scale while Force Pixel-Perfect is enabled.
options.scale.lockTooltip2: The current game resolution is too low for Zoom Scale or HUD Scale to be modified.
options.pixelPerfect.desc:
(Recommended) Forces the zoom scale to be an integer value.
Disabling grants greater control over the zoom scale but may result in fuzzy pixels.
options.hudScale.desc: The scale of the in-game HUD.
options.hudScale.lockTooltip: HUD Scale cannot be modified while Lock HUD Scale is enabled.
options.lockHudScale.desc: Forces the in-game HUD Scale to match the Zoom Scale.
options.fullscreenDisplay.desc:
The display device the window will appear on when running in fullscreen mode.
Selecting "Auto-Detect (Exclusive)" will disable borderless mode but may provide increased compatibility.
options.graphics.desc:
Decrease to disable certain visual effects and lower particle count.
May help with performance on lower-end machines.
options.playerOutlines.desc: Whether outlines should be displayed around players always, only in local co-op, or never.
options.altFont.desc: Enable a larger alternate font for the UI, provides increased text visibility and readability.
options.masterVolume.desc: The volume of the overall game.
options.soundVolume.desc: The volume of all sound effects.
options.automute.desc: Whether or not the game audio will be muted when the game window is not in focus.
options.screenshake.desc: The intensity of screen shake effects.
options.itemMessage.desc: Whether or not a chat message will appear when a player picks up an item in online co-op.
options.autopause.desc: Whether or not the game will pause when the game window is not in focus.
options.profile.desc: The currently selected player profile. Your player profile contains all of the control and accessibility settings that are defined per-player.
options.resetDefault.desc: Reset all of your controls to their original default bindings.
options.resetControlsWarning:
This will reset all of your control bindings to their defaults.
<fntNormal>
<fntLarge>Are you sure?
options.controlCustomizeNote: Controls may be customized from the options menu at any time.
options.replayTutorial.desc: Select this option to play through the in-game tutorial.
options.replayTutorial.lockTooltip: This option may only be selected from the main menu.
options.viewAccessibility.desc: View additional control and accessibility options.
options.rapidFire.desc: Skills that required repeated inputs may be executed by holding the button down.
options.autoJump.desc: Allows holding the jump button to jump again when landing.
options.tapJump.desc: Replaces the 'Jump' button input with the up button. Jumping from ropes now requires pressing left or right.
options.holdSwap.desc: Replaces the 'Swap Equipment' button input with holding the 'Interact' button.
options.hudControls.desc: Displays the inputs to activate skills and equipment on the HUD.
options.miniHudHealth.desc: Displays your health above your character in-game.
options.miniHudSkills.desc: Displays your skill cooldowns above your character in-game.
options.joyconLockTooltip: This option is required when using a single Joy-Con.
options.viewDeadzone.desc: View and configure the deadzones of the control sticks.
options.resetDeadzones.desc: Reset all of your deadzone settings to their original default values.
options.resetDeadzonesWarning:
<y>Warning!
<fntNormal></c>
<fntLarge>This will reset all of your deadzones to their defaults.
<fntNormal>

options.mainDeadzone.desc: The inner deadzone alters how soon your stick will send directional input. Increase this if your stick is sending random inputs without touching it.
options.horzDeadzone.desc: The horizontal deadzones alter the range at which a horizontal input is sent. Widen these if you find it difficult to input straight left or right.
options.vertDeadzone.desc: The vertical deadzones alter the range at which a vertical input is sent. Widen these if you find it difficult to input straight up or down
options.testDeadzones.desc: Temporarily disable menu input so you can test out your chosen deadzone settings.

meatNugget.name: Meat Nugget
meatNugget.pickup: <y>8%</c> chance on hit to <b>drop 2 meat nuggets</c> that <g>heal</c> for <g>2x8 <c_stack>(+6 per stack) <g>health</c>.
meatNugget.description: <y>8%</c> chance on hit to <b>drop 2 meat nuggets</c> that <g>heal</c> for <g>2x8 <c_stack>(+6 per stack) <g>health</c>.
meatNugget.story:
MM. Delicious.

Just kidding, it's awful. I didn't know it was for petmunk, so I thought I would have a sample. BIG. MISTAKE. If its cubic shape wasn't enough to throw you off, it is grey, smelly, and cold. I have no idea why I ate it. Maybe I'm protein deficient.

fireShield.name: Fire Shield
fireShield.pickup: After taking more than <r>10% of your health</c> as damage, explode for <y>400% <c_stack>(+200% per stack) <y>damage</c>, <b>knocking enemies away <c_stack>(+20% force per stack)</c>.
fireShield.description: After taking more than <r>10% of your health</c> as damage, explode for <y>400% <c_stack>(+200% per stack) <y>damage</c>, <b>knocking enemies away <c_stack>(+20% force per stack)</c>.
fireShield.story: The thing is only half-done, but it will do the job. The flux-chains are very unstable, resulting in a large explosion when struck. PLEASE handle with care!

bustlingFungus.name: Bustling Fungus
bustlingFungus.pickup: After standing still for 2 seconds, <g>heal</c> for <g>4.5% <c_stack>(+4.5% per stack)</c> of your <g>health</c> every second to yourself and nearby allies.
bustlingFungus.description: After standing still for 2 seconds, <g>heal</c> for <g>4.5% <c_stack>(+4.5% per stack)</c> of your <g>health</c> every second to yourself and nearby allies.
bustlingFungus.story:
The strongest biological healing agent.. is a mushroom. Found in an abandoned house. I find some humor in that.
This fungus has developed an amazing defense mechanism of hiding underground when bothered, allowing it to live long enough to distribute spores. 

Can be either ground into a paste or.. planted directly into the wound. A small warning; you'll feel it enter you, and it is every bit as unpleasant as it sounds.

lensMakersGlasses.name: Lens Maker's Glasses
lensMakersGlasses.pickup: Your attacks have a <y>10% <c_stack>(+7% per stack)</c> chance to <y>'Critically Strike'</c>, dealing <y>double damage</c>.
lensMakersGlasses.description: Your attacks have a <y>10% <c_stack>(+7% per stack)</c> chance to <y>'Critically Strike'</c>, dealing <y>double damage</c>.
lensMakersGlasses.destination:
Greivenkamp
5th Houston St.
Prism Tower
Earth
lensMakersGlasses.story:
Calibrated for high focal alignment. Should allow for the precision you were asking for. I must ask.. for what reasons do you need such glasses? Surely the Department of Science would provide them for you?

I can't think of a single.. scientific reason why you would want this. Have you been hired by [REDACTED]? If you're in trouble, you can always ask me for help.

sproutingEgg.name: Sprouting Egg
sproutingEgg.pickup: After not being hit for 7 seconds, increase <g>health regeneration</c> by <g>2.4 <c_stack>(+2.4 per stack) <g>hp</c> per second.
sproutingEgg.description: After not being hit for 7 seconds, increase <g>health regeneration</c> by <g>2.4 <c_stack>(+2.4 per stack) <g>hp</c> per second.
sproutingEgg.story:
This egg seems to be somewhere between hatching and dying. Leaving it undisturbed usually causes it to wiggle around a bit, maybe sticking a tendril out. Trying to remove it from its shell is greeted by the most horrible screetching!

I can't bring it to myself to cook it alive. I don't know what to do with it, so here you go; maybe it will hatch in a warmer climate like yours. As useless as he is, I have grown a bit fond of him. Please take care!

headstompers.name: Headstompers
headstompers.pickup: Hurt enemies by falling for up to <y>600% <c_stack>(+300% per stack) <y>damage</c>.
headstompers.description: Hurt enemies by falling for up to <y>600% <c_stack>(+300% per stack) <y>damage</c>.
headstompers.story:
Have you found the kill-count of your shoes to be 0? Do you find that disturbing? So do we. Combat Ready Spikeshoes, lovingly nicknamed 'Headstompers,' allow you to get the drop on foes. Literally. Vertically.

Titanium-tipped spikes, along with steel soles, guarantee that landing on foes will result in the messiest recreation of old school video games that you have ever seen. NOTE: Spikes deploy only after reaching a certain vertical velocity.

lifeSavings.name: Life Savings
lifeSavings.pickup: Generate <y>$1 <c_stack>(+$1 per stack)</c> every 3 seconds. Scales with time.
lifeSavings.description: Generate <y>$1 <c_stack>(+$1 per stack)</c> every 3 seconds. Scales with time.
lifeSavings.story: hi im billy and heer is money for mom thanks

barbedWire.name: Barbed Wire
barbedWire.pickup: Hurt <y>1</c> enemy within <y>1m <c_stack>(+0.2m per stack)</c> for <y>50% <c_stack>(+10% per stack) <y>damage</c> every <y>0.5</c> seconds.
barbedWire.description: Hurt <y>1</c> enemy within <y>1m <c_stack>(+0.2m per stack)</c> for <y>50% <c_stack>(+10% per stack) <y>damage</c> every <y>0.5</c> seconds.
barbedWire.story:
Great big bundle of barbed wire! Should help you.. 'catch fish?' Not sure what use barbed wire is for catching fish, but all the power to ya!
Should have about 500 ft included. The safety layer dissolves in water, so simply drop it on your tub and its ready to roll.

Disclaimer: I, or my company, am not responsible for any bodily harm delivered to..

rustyKnife.name: Rusty Knife
rustyKnife.pickup: <y>15% <c_stack>(+15% per stack) <r>chance to bleed</c> an enemy for <y>4x35% TOTAL damage</c>.
rustyKnife.description: <y>15% <c_stack>(+15% per stack) <r>chance to bleed</c> an enemy for <y>4x35% TOTAL damage</c>.
rustyKnife.story:
Murder weapon, case name ELIAS. Probably a lover's spat? Make sure to box it; I've heard some men in suits were asking around.
There is still dried blood on the knife, so mark it as biological.

mysteriousVial.name: Mysterious Vial
mysteriousVial.pickup: Increase <g>health regeneration</c> by <g>0.84 <c_stack>(+0.84 per stack) <g>hp</c> per second.
mysteriousVial.description: Increase <g>health regeneration</c> by <g>0.84 <c_stack>(+0.84 per stack) <g>hp</c> per second.
mysteriousVial.destination:
Sheridan S.
4000 15th Ave
UNITED STATES
Earth
mysteriousVial.story:
Apply to skin for a rapidly acting gel that contains both antiseptics and an agent to encourage protein synthesis!

Small wounds applied with our gel should heal within a maximum of 5 hours, while broken bones and torn ligaments may take a few weeks.

NOTE: Side effects may include itching, rashes, bleeding, sensitivity of skin, dry patches, permanent scarring, misaligned bone regrowth, rotting of the..

mortarTube.name: Mortar Tube
pickupChance to launch a mortar.

,
			 to fire a mortar for <y>170% <c_stack>(+170% per stack) <y>TOTAL damage</c>.
mortarTube.story:
Well, uh.. it's a little outdated. You stick explosives down the end, then you fire the explosive. With more explosives. If you're trying to reduce your injury rate, don't use these. 

Other than its archaic design, the mortar tube is actually pretty decent if you get a lot of them in a battery. Can blanket a big area, like [REDACTED]. I suppose you can beat them with the tube afterwards.

warbanner.name: Warbanner
warbanner.pickup: On <b>level up</c> or <b>activating the Teleporter</c>, drop a banner that strengthens all allies within <y>4.6m <c_stack>(+1.4m per stack)</c>. Raise <y>attack</c> and <b>movement</c> speed by <y>30%</c> and damage by <y>4</c>. Also <g>heals</c> for <g>1%</c> of your <g>health</c> every second.
warbanner.description: On <b>level up</c> or <b>activating the Teleporter</c>, drop a banner that strengthens all allies within <y>4.6m <c_stack>(+1.4m per stack)</c>. Raise <y>attack</c> and <b>movement</c> speed by <y>30%</c> and damage by <y>4</c>. Also <g>heals</c> for <g>1%</c> of your <g>health</c> every second.
warbanner.story:
Very very valuable. Don't drop it; it's worth more than you.

What is it? Well, are you blind? It's obviously a warbanner from the War of 2019 from one of the rebel groups. Yes, maybe a little overdramatic, but inspiring nonetheless. They say - they say that warbanners won the war for them. Gave them.. magical strength.

monsterTooth.name: Monster Tooth
monsterTooth.pickup: Killing an enemy heals you for <g>10 <c_stack>(+5 per stack) <g>health</c>.
monsterTooth.description: Killing an enemy heals you for <g>10 <c_stack>(+5 per stack) <g>health</c>.
monsterTooth.story:
Ripped it RIGHT out of 'is mouth! A big fight that one gave me, I tell ya! Wrestled me right down, jaws wrapped around my head! Good thing Bishop here got him with that vaporiser, eh? Hahaha!

It's been my good luck charm for a while, but hey, with the money you're payin' for it I'll give 'er up. Sometimes I feel like it helped me on hunts though, ya know? Like.. instincts.

crowbar.name: Crowbar
crowbar.pickup: Deal <y>+50% <c_stack>(+30% per stack) <y>damage</c> to enemies above <y>80% health</c>.
crowbar.description: Deal <y>+50% <c_stack>(+30% per stack) <y>damage</c> to enemies above <y>80% health</c>.
crowbar.story: Crowbar/prybar/wrecking bar allows for both prying and smashing! Carbon steel, so it should last for a very long time, at least until the 3rd edition arrives.

medkit.name: Medkit
medkit.pickup: <g>Heal</c> for <g>10 <c_stack>(+10 per stack) <g>health</c> <b>1.5 seconds</c> after getting hurt.
medkit.description: <g>Heal</c> for <g>10 <c_stack>(+10 per stack) <g>health</c> <b>1.5 seconds</c> after getting hurt.
medkit.story:
Alright, big shipment coming in. Each Medkit should contain bandages, sterile dressings, soap, antiseptics, saline, gloves, scissors, aspirin, codeine, and an epinephrine auto-injector. Should be a huge step up from what you had before, and should.. uh, prevent any future problems like last week. 

Thanks.

bundleOfFireworks.name: Bundle of Fireworks
bundleOfFireworks.pickup: Activating an interactable <y>launches 6 <c_stack>(+3 per stack) <y>fireworks</c> that deal <y>300% base damage</c>.
bundleOfFireworks.description: Activating an interactable <y>launches 6 <c_stack>(+3 per stack) <y>fireworks</c> that deal <y>300% base damage</c>.
bundleOfFireworks.story: Yeah, celebration! Bought these from a friend, forgot where he said he got them. I'm glad that we finally re-legalized residential use of fireworks in 2054 after the... well, the terrorist attacks. Disguising homing missiles as fireworks? Don't ever quote me on it, but it was pretty smart. Anyways, these are for your kids to use. Have fun!

taser.name: Taser
taser.pickup: <y>7%</c> chance on hit to <y>snare</c> enemies for <y>1.5 <c_stack>(+0.5 per stack) <y>seconds</c>.
taser.description: <y>7%</c> chance on hit to <y>snare</c> enemies for <y>1.5 <c_stack>(+0.5 per stack) <y>seconds</c>.
taser.story: You say you can fix 'em? These tasers are very very faulty; got a few of my officers hurt they did. They fire, but they don't do nothin' like, 99% of the time! My department is running low on money, so I expect a good deal for these!

paulsGoatHoof.name: Paul's Goat Hoof
paulsGoatHoof.story: A hoof from one of my goats; I noticed one day that one of my goats had an abnormaly large foot. Thinking it was cancerous, I went to the doctors and lo-and-behold; it was. My goat died shortly after.

bitterRoot.name: Bitter Root
bitterRoot.story:
Biggest. Ginseng. Root. Ever.

Not really, but it's pretty freakin' huge. You can boil it or sun dry it, whatever you want. I'll be curious to see if your cancer research actually pans out; sounds like voodoo magic to me, herbal medicine, but if the natives say it works, it works.

stickyBomb.name: Sticky Bomb
stickyBomb.pickup: <y>9%</c> chance on hit to attach a <y>bomb</c> to an enemy, detonating for <y>140% <c_stack>(+140% per stack) <y>TOTAL damage</c>.
stickyBomb.description: <y>9%</c> chance on hit to attach a <y>bomb</c> to an enemy, detonating for <y>140% <c_stack>(+140% per stack) <y>TOTAL damage</c>.
stickyBomb.story:
Jesus, okay. The only reason I'm sending you guys another shipment is because of what you did for Shelby. Consider that debt paid.

Since you APPARENTLY didn't get my message the first time, I'll tell you again. See the orange end? Don't touch it. Once you take the wrapping off, the adhesive is ACTIVE. DON'T TOUCH IT. YOU STICK THAT END ON BAD THINGS, NOT YOURSELF. 

The cadets? Those lives are on you, not me.

soldiersSyringe.name: Soldier's Syringe
soldiersSyringe.story:
Should help with multi-purpose requirements needed of soldiers. Contains vaccinations, antibiotics, pain killers, steroids, heroin, gasoline.. and something that feels like burning. 
Use standard procedures for injections.. clean the area, sterilize, no air, give them a candy, etc.

Works for my boys, so no reason it shouldn't work for yours! The more shots the better; very few of my men have actually died from overdosing on it. Most just get sick.

snakeEyes.name: Snake Eyes
snakeEyes.pickup: <b>Failing a shrine</c> increases <y>critical chance</c> by <y>7% <c_stack>(+7% per stack)</c>, up to <y>6 times</c>. Resets at the start of each stage.
snakeEyes.description: <b>Failing a shrine</c> increases <y>critical chance</c> by <y>7% <c_stack>(+7% per stack)</c>, up to <y>6 times</c>. Resets at the start of each stage.
snakeEyes.story:
You dirty ---------er. You KNEW I had to win to pay off my debts. Are you in with the casinos? Of course you are; a snake like you would. A dice that's loaded for SNAKE EYES. CUTE MOVE, --------er.

I'm comin' for you, ----.

hermitsScarf.name: Hermit's Scarf
hermitsScarf.pickup: <g>10% <c_stack>(+10% per stack)</c> chance to <g>evade</c> incoming damage.
hermitsScarf.description: <g>10% <c_stack>(+10% per stack)</c> chance to <g>evade</c> incoming damage.
hermitsScarf.story:
So you know the solar flare, from a few days ago? Well it destroyed the lower district, and I was on clean-up crew. 

Found this scarf in the rubble, essentially untouched. All these dead bodies and strewn pieces, and this scarf is peeking out like some ----in flag. I know I shouldn't have taken it home, but I did. I.. feel safer with it. This thing survived that horrible day, it must be able to survive whatever I have to endure, right? Haha..

gasoline.name: Gasoline
gasoline.pickup: Killing enemies burns the ground for <y>60% <c_stack>(+40% per stack) <y>damage</c>.
gasoline.description: Killing enemies burns the ground for <y>60% <c_stack>(+40% per stack) <y>damage</c>.
gasoline.story:
Gasoline, eh? Surprising to find a gas station these days, with everyone drivin' around them electro cars.
Got yourself quite a few gallons, so for the few cars and planes left runnin on gas.. this should do it!
Very flammable, even the fumes, so be careful now!

spikestrip.name: Spikestrip
spikestrip.pickup: When hit, drop spikestrips that <y>snare</c> enemies for <y>1 <c_stack>(+0.5 per stack) <y>second</c>.
spikestrip.description: When hit, drop spikestrips that <y>snare</c> enemies for <y>1 <c_stack>(+0.5 per stack) <y>second</c>.
spikestrip.story:
Hey bud! Do you remember... summer of 2032, was it? The night with Alicia? Well, um, remember when we got waay too drunk and broke into the police station? Well, I still have those spikestrips from then. Haha, good times right? 

The doctors say I don't have much time left. Since you're in the force now and all, I felt obligated to return it to you! Haha. So.. yeah. Hope you're doing well. It's been lonely here without you.

timeKeepersSecret.name: Time Keeper's Secret
timeKeepersSecret.pickup: Falling below <r>25% health</c> stops time for <y>3 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <y>seconds</c>. Recharges after <b>7 minutes</c>.
timeKeepersSecret.description: Falling below <r>25% health</c> stops time for <y>3 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <y>seconds</c>. Recharges after <b>7 minutes</c>.
timeKeepersSecret.story:
My old grandfather's hourglass. As the Time Keeper in the Hall of The Revered, he valued this hourglass a lot. He claimed that it would keep him safe in times of danger. For some reason, the sand never seems to run out! That's all an illusion, however. There must be some mechanism at the bottom of the hourglass that replenishes the top well. Very cute.

My old grandfather's hourglass. As the Time Keeper in the..

smartShopper.name: Smart Shopper
smartShopper.pickup: Killed enemies drop <y>25% <c_stack>(+25% per stack) <y>more gold</c>.
smartShopper.description: Killed enemies drop <y>25% <c_stack>(+25% per stack) <y>more gold</c>.
smartShopper.destination:
200 West Street,
City of Gold,
Earth
smartShopper.story:
Honey! HONEY! Look! I /told/ you I still had enough left over! Yeah, weird huh? I swear the last $5 I used was the last one I had in my purse, but then when I looked again, I still had a bit left over. Strange, huh? 

Maybe it's black magic, haha! Honey?

infusion.name: Infusion
infusion.pickup: Killing an enemy increases your <g>health permanently</c> by <g>1 <c_stack>(+0.5 per stack)</c>.
infusion.description: Killing an enemy increases your <g>health permanently</c> by <g>1 <c_stack>(+0.5 per stack)</c>.
infusion.story:
Contains samples from bears, leeches, tigers, elephants, elephant sharks, sharks, bull sharks, ants, and anteaters. Simply hook up to a dialysis machine along with the necessary equipment and swap out your blood for genetically superior ones!

You can add whatever blood sample you want, as far as I know. Just make sure you take the pills that allow the body to accept the new blood, or your body will reject the cross-species infusion. Remember that sampling from other animals is a great basis for experimentation!

willOTheWisp.name: Will-o'-the-wisp
willOTheWisp.pickup: <y>33%</c> chance on killing an enemy to create a <y>lava pillar</c> for <y>300% <c_stack>(+200% per stack) <y>damage</c>, <b>knocking enemies upwards</c>.
willOTheWisp.description: <y>33%</c> chance on killing an enemy to create a <y>lava pillar</c> for <y>300% <c_stack>(+200% per stack) <y>damage</c>, <b>knocking enemies upwards</c>.
willOTheWisp.story: Found the little thing on my last hike up. Tiny guy; must be a baby. He (she?) doesn't seem to eat anything at all, so I'm hoping you guys can help the fella out. I don't think he can get out of the jar; it hasn't made any attempt to.

atgMissileMk1.name: AtG Missile Mk. 1
atgMissileMk1.pickup: <y>10% <c_stack>(+10% per stack)</c> chance on hit to fire a missile that deals <y>300% TOTAL damage</c>.
atgMissileMk1.description: <y>10% <c_stack>(+10% per stack)</c> chance on hit to fire a missile that deals <y>300% TOTAL damage</c>.
atgMissileMk1.destination:
Fort Joseph
Belt Num.1053
[REDACTED]
Boron System
atgMissileMk1.story:
Shipment of [REDACTED] AtG Viper Missiles for Fort Joseph. 

Lightweight and attachable to torso for free use of both hands. Can store up to 120 heat-seeking missiles, which is just what your men need to fight off the [REDACTED]

toughTimes.name: Tough Times
toughTimes.story:
"Bears are just about the only toy that can lose just about everything and still maintain their dignity and worth." - Samantha Armstrong.

Don't forget, hon. I'm coming home soon. Stay strong.

energyCell.name: Energy Cell
energyCell.pickup: Increases <y>attack speed</c> by up to <y>40% <c_stack>(+30% per stack)</c> at <r>low health</c>.
energyCell.description: Increases <y>attack speed</c> by up to <y>40% <c_stack>(+30% per stack)</c> at <r>low health</c>.
energyCell.story:
FOR: ----- - J. 
CC#: ---- ---- - ---
ACCT#: 200158
Use ONLY in fusion - based vehicles and machinery. Do NOT upload to mainframe.

rustyJetpack.name: Rusty Jetpack
rustyJetpack.pickup: Decrease <b>gravity</c> while holding the jump button by <b>10% <c_stack>(-10% per stack)</c> and increase <b>jump height <c_stack>(increases per stack)</c>.
rustyJetpack.description: Decrease <b>gravity</c> while holding the jump button by <b>10% <c_stack>(-10% per stack)</c> and increase <b>jump height <c_stack>(increases per stack)</c>.
rustyJetpack.story:
Sorry, it seems to be broken. It only works for a split second; maybe I'll send you a fully working jetpack in a few months? Should work well enough for the carnival! 
Make sure to keep the kiddos away from the bottom; it shoots out quite a jet. Can make for fun obstacle challenges.

leechingSeed.name: Leeching Seed
leechingSeed.pickup: Attacking enemies heals you for <g>2 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <g>health</c>.
leechingSeed.description: Attacking enemies heals you for <g>2 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <g>health</c>.
leechingSeed.story:
These seeds are recently germinating, so be quick! These flesh-infesting pods seem to burrow, balloon, and then pop in a few months. Most test patients have.. died. However, before they die, they feel increased health and state of mind! 
In fact, the pods themselves seem to develop spores, which if collected can be turned into a pain reliever.. 

Find a way to stop its growth cycle at that state, and you have yourself a great healing agent.

ukulele.name: Ukulele
ukulele.pickup: <y>20% chance</c> on hit to fire <y>chain lightning</c> for <y>66% <c_stack>(+66% per stack) <y>TOTAL damage</c> on up to <y>3</c> targets.
ukulele.description: <y>20% chance</c> on hit to fire <y>chain lightning</c> for <y>66% <c_stack>(+66% per stack) <y>TOTAL damage</c> on up to <y>3</c> targets.
ukulele.story:
Very rare artifact! An ancient ukulele, from the legendary artist born on Mars. It was said that he was a son of a god, gifted with the power of lightning himself. 
People say that he was the most humble man.. and that his music was simply.. electric!

NOTE: No tests have managed to make the ukulele actually generate electricity. Use with care.

boxingGloves.name: Boxing Gloves
boxingGloves.pickup: <y>6% <c_stack>(+6% per stack)</c> chance on hitting enemies to <b>knock them back</c> for <y>100% TOTAL damage</c>.
boxingGloves.description: <y>6% <c_stack>(+6% per stack)</c> chance on hitting enemies to <b>knock them back</c> for <y>100% TOTAL damage</c>.
boxingGloves.story: These should work fine for the kids you're training. A bit musty, though. It'll make your trainees hit like a pro, ha!

prisonShackles.name: Prison Shackles
prisonShackles.pickup: <b>Slow</c> enemies on hit for <b>-50% movement speed</c> for <y>1.5 <c_stack>(+0.5 per stack) <y>seconds</c>.
prisonShackles.description: <b>Slow</c> enemies on hit for <b>-50% movement speed</c> for <y>1.5 <c_stack>(+0.5 per stack) <y>seconds</c>.
prisonShackles.story:
An artifact from the old ages, before we used holo-cuffs. The advantage is that EMP blasts and remote-hacking can't disable good-old steel and chains. Fitting this on larger prisoners may be harder.
I know you guys have been having a serious break-out problem in the last few months, and this is sure to throw those prison breakers for a loop. Just don't lose the key.

We are shipping about.. 500, because we have nothing better to do with them than smelt them for steel, which is barely worth more than dirt this day and age. Would probably cost more than getting rid of them.

guardiansHeart.name: Guardian's Heart
guardiansHeart.pickup: Gain a <b>60 <c_stack>(+60 per stack) <b>health shield</c>. Recharges when outside of danger for <b>7</c> seconds.
guardiansHeart.description: Gain a <b>60 <c_stack>(+60 per stack) <b>health shield</c>. Recharges when outside of danger for <b>7</c> seconds.
guardiansHeart.story:
Test subject 150053 results. While living, the subject had advanced muscle growth, cell regeneration, higher agility, and increased intelligence, along with a blue hue to his skin. 
On 08/23/2056, the subject broke free of his restraints and freed all other test subjects. All test subjects, including 150053, were terminated.

His heart seems to still beat independent of the rest of his body. Perhaps a transplant into another subject can continue research.

hopooFeather.name: Hopoo Feather
hopooFeather.story: A feather from the hopoo, found only natively in Europa. Ever since its extreme light-weight vs tensile strength was discovered, the hopoo was almost driven to extinction from poaching. There are only 3 left; I hope you can keep their location safe.

frostRelic.name: Frost Relic
frostRelic.pickup: Killing an enemy surrounds you with <y>3 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <y>icicles</c> that deal <y>33% damage each</c> every <y>0.33</c> seconds.
frostRelic.description: Killing an enemy surrounds you with <y>3 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <y>icicles</c> that deal <y>33% damage each</c> every <y>0.33</c> seconds.
frostRelic.story: Biggest snowflake, to date. Technically, it isn't a snowflake, it's just a chunk of ice, but STILL. That's hard to sell as a museum piece. Anyways, the thing is hard as rock; I got drunk one day and dropped it on the floor, and it went right through, so don't worry about transportation.

redWhip.name: Red Whip
redWhip.pickup: Leaving combat for <y>2</c> seconds boosts your <b>movement speed</c> by <b>60% <c_stack>(+60% per stack)</c>.
redWhip.description: Leaving combat for <y>2</c> seconds boosts your <b>movement speed</c> by <b>60% <c_stack>(+60% per stack)</c>.
redWhip.story: I know exactly why you want these and I want you to never tell me.

chargefieldGenerator.name: Chargefield Generator
chargefieldGenerator.pickup: Killing an enemy creates a <y>ring of lightning</c> that deals <y>50% <c_stack>(+20% per stack) <y>damage</c> every <y>0.5</c> seconds to <b>50%</c> of enemies within. The ring starts with a radius of <y>4.7m</c> and <y>grows by 1.3m each kill</c> up to <y>40m</c>. Lasts for <y>6</c> seconds without killing enemies.
chargefieldGenerator.description: Killing an enemy creates a <y>ring of lightning</c> that deals <y>50% <c_stack>(+20% per stack) <y>damage</c> every <y>0.5</c> seconds to <b>50%</c> of enemies within. The ring starts with a radius of <y>4.7m</c> and <y>grows by 1.3m each kill</c> up to <y>40m</c>. Lasts for <y>6</c> seconds without killing enemies.
chargefieldGenerator.story:
You know those anti-theft devices you can stick on your car? Yeah, it's like that, but for an individual. How it is used is up to you guys; first thought is military or self-protection.

You need to charge it generally after every use. It can /actually/ be charged off of bio-electrical signals, which sounds strange because of how weak they are, but in times of desperation we've found that effective as well. Up to you.

armsRace.name: Arms Race
armsRace.pickup: Drones gain a <y>5% <c_stack>(+5% per stack)</c> chance on hit to fire a missile for <y>300% TOTAL damage</c>, and a <y>9%</c> chance on hit to fire a mortar for <y>85% <c_stack>(+85% per stack) <y>TOTAL damage</c>. <b>Summons a unique drone</c> which regenerates each stage.
armsRace.description: Drones gain a <y>5% <c_stack>(+5% per stack)</c> chance on hit to fire a missile for <y>300% TOTAL damage</c>, and a <y>9%</c> chance on hit to fire a mortar for <y>85% <c_stack>(+85% per stack) <y>TOTAL damage</c>. <b>Summons a unique drone</c> which regenerates each stage.
armsRace.story:
Psst. Hey. Yeah, I'm whispering over text.

So the upgrades for your drones are in. It's compatible with all KS-I slotted drones, even the non-combat oriented ones, so you can refurbish some of your cleaning units to help in the fight. Strap it onto the back, and the drone AI should sort itself out. Contains both a missile and mortar launcher. Let's continue this arms race, eh?

goldenGun.name: Golden Gun
goldenGun.pickup: Deal <y>bonus damage</c> based on <y>current gold</c>, up to <y>40% damage</c>. Caps at <y>700 <c_stack>(-50% per stack) <y>gold</c>. Scales with time.
goldenGun.description: Deal <y>bonus damage</c> based on <y>current gold</c>, up to <y>40% damage</c>. Caps at <y>700 <c_stack>(-50% per stack) <y>gold</c>. Scales with time.
goldenGun.story: Was this supposed to.. intimidate me? I do like its look, however; perhaps I'll set it above my fireplace.

56LeafClover.name: 56 Leaf Clover
56LeafClover.pickup: Elite mobs have a <b>4% <c_stack>(+1.5% per stack) <b>chance</c> to <b>drop items</c>.
56LeafClover.description: Elite mobs have a <b>4% <c_stack>(+1.5% per stack) <b>chance</c> to <b>drop items</c>.
56LeafClover.story: A FIFTY-FREAKIN-SIX leaf clover! It was sent to me from a fan, picked from the top of Mount Drummond. It lived through the mountain fire; imagine that! I'm keeping it in observation to make sure it doesn't wilt; this is a once in a lifetime specimen! Think of all the elixirs we could make.. I may use a few of them myself and go hit the lottery!

concussionGrenade.name: Concussion Grenade
concussionGrenade.pickup: <y>6% <c_stack>(+6% per stack)</c> chance on hitting enemies to <y>stun</c> them for <y>2</c> seconds.
concussionGrenade.description: <y>6% <c_stack>(+6% per stack)</c> chance on hitting enemies to <y>stun</c> them for <y>2</c> seconds.
concussionGrenade.story:
Designed to detonate directly on impact and disorient targets. Fires pellets intended for stunning, not for killing! SWAT teams will love these, but any men you have on the field should use fragmentation grenades instead.

Pull the pin and throw in the general direction of the bad guys. If you can't figure it out, you deserve to get hurt.

filialImprinting.name: Filial Imprinting
filialImprinting.pickup: Hatch <b>1 <c_stack>(+1 per stack)</c> strange creature who drops <b>buffs</c> every <y>20</c> seconds. Buffs temporarily boost either <b>movement speed</c>, <y>attack speed</c>, or <g>health regen</c>.
filialImprinting.description: Hatch <b>1 <c_stack>(+1 per stack)</c> strange creature who drops <b>buffs</c> every <y>20</c> seconds. Buffs temporarily boost either <b>movement speed</c>, <y>attack speed</c>, or <g>health regen</c>.
filialImprinting.story:
You didn't tell me the roe was FERTILIZED. Good lord! Anyways, one of the suckers actually hatched, and has been nothing but friendly to me. Filial imprinting, perhaps.

I quite like the little guy. He's almost dog-like in how affectionate he is to me. I.. have begun to care a lot about the thing. I've been feeding him nutapples and he seems to enjoy it, but I doubt that's very nutritious. Suggestions?

deadMansFoot.name: Dead Man's Foot
deadMansFoot.pickup: Chance when damaged to drop a <y>poison mine</c> that deals <y>150% damage</c> and poisons for <y>x600% <c_stack>(+450% per stack) <y>damage</c> over time. Chance to drop starts at <y>15%</c> and increases with <r>low health</c>.
deadMansFoot.description: Chance when damaged to drop a <y>poison mine</c> that deals <y>150% damage</c> and poisons for <y>x600% <c_stack>(+450% per stack) <y>damage</c> over time. Chance to drop starts at <y>15%</c> and increases with <r>low health</c>.
deadMansFoot.story: Poor guy. It looked like he was infested by some bug-like creatures, and exploded when I got close. I hope his death wasn't too painful; his family will know how he died. Rest in peace.

toxicCentipede.name: Toxic Centipede
toxicCentipede.pickup: <r>Infect</c> a nearby enemy on contact for <y>6 <c_stack>(+2 per stack) <y>seconds</c>, dealing <y>50% damage</c> every <y>0.5</c> seconds. Bounces to other enemies if the target dies. Recharges every <b>6 <c_stack>(-33% per stack) <b>seconds</c>.
toxicCentipede.description: <r>Infect</c> a nearby enemy on contact for <y>6 <c_stack>(+2 per stack) <y>seconds</c>, dealing <y>50% damage</c> every <y>0.5</c> seconds. Bounces to other enemies if the target dies. Recharges every <b>6 <c_stack>(-33% per stack) <b>seconds</c>.
toxicCentipede.destination:
Carolyn Williams
Rare/Extinct
Study Center
Venus
toxicCentipede.story:
Extremely interesting species found on OMEGA-19. Resembles a worm, snake, or limbless lizard. Seems to exude poison from its glands, so much that the 'worm' can't even contain it in its mouth.

May be a strain of stomach parasites found on other planets, but obviously much larger and deadlier. I hope you find some interesting knowledge from this species; it killed 16 of our workers alone. 
It also seemed to give offspring every time, but we have only found 13. Please respond quickly.

harvestersScythe.name: Harvester's Scythe
harvestersScythe.pickup: Gain <y>5% critical chance</c>. <y>Critical strikes <g>heal</c> for <g>8 <c_stack>(+2 per stack) <g>health</c>.
harvestersScythe.description: Gain <y>5% critical chance</c>. <y>Critical strikes <g>heal</c> for <g>8 <c_stack>(+2 per stack) <g>health</c>.
harvestersScythe.story: It takes a brave man to look death in the eye and claim they don't need help.

panicMines.name: Panic Mines
panicMines.pickup: Chance when damaged to drop <y>1 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <y>mine</c> that deals <y>400% damage</c>. Chance to drop starts at <y>15%</c> and increases with <r>low health</c>.
panicMines.description: Chance when damaged to drop <y>1 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <y>mine</c> that deals <y>400% damage</c>. Chance to drop starts at <y>15%</c> and increases with <r>low health</c>.
panicMines.story:
Must be strapped onto vehicles, NOT personnel! After taking heavy fire, the automatic dispenser should drop and arm a mine to make a hasty retreat (or blow enemies sky-high who are dumb enough to follow.)
Includes smart-fire, but leave the blast radius regardless. The laws of physics don't pick sides. Very high yield for how small it is.

If you want to use it offensively.. then.. well just get shot. A lot. Preferably by small arms fire, or you'll die trying to have the mines drop.

predatoryInstincts.name: Predatory Instincts
predatoryInstincts.pickup: Gain <y>5% critical chance</c>. <y>Critical strikes</c> increase <y>attack speed</c> by <y>10% <c_stack>(+7% per stack)</c>. Maximum cap of <y>30% <c_stack>(+21% per stack) <y>attack speed</c>.
predatoryInstincts.description: Gain <y>5% critical chance</c>. <y>Critical strikes</c> increase <y>attack speed</c> by <y>10% <c_stack>(+7% per stack)</c>. Maximum cap of <y>30% <c_stack>(+21% per stack) <y>attack speed</c>.
predatoryInstincts.story: Wolves. Nasty creatures. Was tendin' my crops, then a pack of 'em come out. I thought the mine field finished them all off, but the big guy, the alpha dog, was still around. Came RIGHT after me. Gut the thing right then and there. The hunter is now the hunted, eh? You ain't sayin much anymore, are ya?

thallium.name: Thallium
thallium.pickup: <y>10% <c_stack>(+10% per stack)</c> chance on hit to damage by up to <y>2x500% enemy damage per second</c> and slow for up to <b>-150% movement speed</c> over the course of <y>3 seconds</c>.
thallium.description: <y>10% <c_stack>(+10% per stack)</c> chance on hit to damage by up to <y>2x500% enemy damage per second</c> and slow for up to <b>-150% movement speed</c> over the course of <y>3 seconds</c>.

teslaCoil.name: Tesla Coil
teslaCoil.pickup: Passively <y>shock</c> nearby enemies for <y>120% <c_stack>(+60% per stack) <y>damage</c>.
teslaCoil.description: Passively <y>shock</c> nearby enemies for <y>120% <c_stack>(+60% per stack) <y>damage</c>.
teslaCoil.story: A memorial perfect for your Tesla museum. Fit enough for Mr. Tesla himself! Make sure you keep the thing in the glass vacuum as we talked about. Even then, keep the safety lines at least 5 feet AWAY from the glass. You don't want your centerpiece killing your guests, huh?

oldBox.name: Old Box
oldBox.pickup: Chance when damaged to drop a <y>jack-in-the-box</c>, <r>fearing enemies</c> for <y>2 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <y>seconds</c>. Chance to drop starts at <y>10%</c> and increases with <r>low health</c>.
oldBox.description: Chance when damaged to drop a <y>jack-in-the-box</c>, <r>fearing enemies</c> for <y>2 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <y>seconds</c>. Chance to drop starts at <y>10%</c> and increases with <r>low health</c>.
oldBox.story: Musty, saggy, loose box. You can see it was used a lot already. Its bad shape honestly makes it scarier; you never know when the stupid thing pops out again. Sometimes it sits in there for days!

beatingEmbryo.name: Beating Embryo
beatingEmbryo.pickup: Equipment has a <y>30% <c_stack>(+30% per stack) <y>chance</c> to deal <y>double</c> the effect.
beatingEmbryo.description: Equipment has a <y>30% <c_stack>(+30% per stack) <y>chance</c> to deal <y>double</c> the effect.
beatingEmbryo.destination:
Carolyn Williams
Rare/Extinct
Study Center
Venus
beatingEmbryo.story:
Ah. We seem to have found a.. hive of sorts. Without its caretaker, however, most of the eggs seemed to have died off. Must have been caused by our previous specimen.
KEEP IT REFRIGERATED. You do not want this.. beating embryo.. hatching in your care. God knows what will happen.

permafrost.name: Permafrost
permafrost.pickup: <y>13%</c> chance on hit to <y>freeze enemies for 1.5 seconds</c> while slowing by <b>-80% movement speed</c> for <b>3 <c_stack>(+1.5 per stack) <b>seconds</c>.
permafrost.description: <y>13%</c> chance on hit to <y>freeze enemies for 1.5 seconds</c> while slowing by <b>-80% movement speed</c> for <b>3 <c_stack>(+1.5 per stack) <b>seconds</c>.
permafrost.story: The core of this ice cube is VERY VERY close to absolute zero, much closer than anything we made in the lab before. Test it! TEST! This will lead to HUGE breakthroughs in superconductor technology.

atgMissileMk2.name: AtG Missile Mk. 2
atgMissileMk2.pickup: <y>7% <c_stack>(+7% per stack)</c> chance on hit to fire three missiles that deal <y>3x300% TOTAL damage</c>.
atgMissileMk2.description: <y>7% <c_stack>(+7% per stack)</c> chance on hit to fire three missiles that deal <y>3x300% TOTAL damage</c>.
atgMissileMk2.destination:
Fort Joseph
Belt Num.1053
[REDACTED]
Boron System
atgMissileMk2.story: Test System for Viper Missiles. Should now [REDACTED] on use instead of just one. Do not use on the field; it is UNSTABLE. I am only sending [REDACTED] shipments, so be smart.

happiestMask.name: Happiest Mask
happiestMask.pickup: Killed enemies spawn <b>ghosts</c> that last <b>15 seconds</c> with <b>100% <c_stack>(+20% per stack) <b>health</c> and <b>70% <c_stack>(+30% per stack) <b>damage</c>.
happiestMask.description: Killed enemies spawn <b>ghosts</c> that last <b>15 seconds</c> with <b>100% <c_stack>(+20% per stack) <b>health</c> and <b>70% <c_stack>(+30% per stack) <b>damage</c>.
happiestMask.story:
This is GREAT! The circus is just as GOOD as I hoped it to be; it is a dream come true! I'm so GLAD that I followed my dream. I love you; tell mom too. Tell her..

I'm happy! I'M HAPPY! SEE! I SAID I'M HAPPY PLEASE DON'T

plasmaChain.name: Plasma Chain
plasmaChain.pickup: Chance on hit to <y>tether</c> onto up to <b>1 <c_stack>(+1 per stack)</c> enemy dealing <y>60% damage per 0.5 seconds</c> to any enemies in the path.
plasmaChain.description: Chance on hit to <y>tether</c> onto up to <b>1 <c_stack>(+1 per stack)</c> enemy dealing <y>60% damage per 0.5 seconds</c> to any enemies in the path.
plasmaChain.story:
Hey there, my wife and I am returning a lost plasma chain. It is still fully operational and can haul my spaceship easily, so we expect the full reward! 

We found it in an unmarked cave with a very large claw wrapped around it. The serial number should tell you the previous owner; the finder's fee can be sent to the same account that I'm sending this message from. Thank you.

heavenCracker.name: Heaven Cracker
heavenCracker.pickup: Every <b>4 <c_stack>(-1 per stack) <b>basic attacks</c> <y>pierce through enemies</c>.
heavenCracker.description: Every <b>4 <c_stack>(-1 per stack) <b>basic attacks</c> <y>pierce through enemies</c>.
heavenCracker.story:
Contains about 500 horse power of torque. Diamond tipped and coated, along with composite steel. Strong enough to pierce the most heavenly of materials.
Can be used for  manual drilling, or swap to laser-mode to fire a mining laser instead. The former will wear it out much quicker, but will also have better results.

Why I bother telling you all this is beyond me. You people aren't planning on using it for mining anyways.

rapidMitosis.name: Rapid Mitosis
rapidMitosis.pickup: Reduce the <b>cooldown of equipment</c> by <b>25% <c_stack>(+25% per stack)</c>.
rapidMitosis.description: Reduce the <b>cooldown of equipment</c> by <b>25% <c_stack>(+25% per stack)</c>.
rapidMitosis.story:
Very interesting sample. Found in the egg of an indigenous species in Sector 13. It undergoes mitosis that we all know, but at a much faster rate; about 2140x faster. Obviously can be useful for medicinal purposes. 

Make sure to follow the instructions included to keep the sample alive. We have sent it frozen to stop the rapid duplications; since it increases in cell count exponentially, it could very well spiral out of control otherwise.

ceremonialDagger.name: Ceremonial Dagger
ceremonialDagger.pickup: Killing an enemy fires out <b>4 <c_stack>(+2 per stack) <b>heat seaking bolts</c> that deal <y>100% damage</c>.
ceremonialDagger.description: Killing an enemy fires out <b>4 <c_stack>(+2 per stack) <b>heat seaking bolts</c> that deal <y>100% damage</c>.
ceremonialDagger.story: Finally found the heretic. Foolish boy, thinking he could save his sister. With the knife returned, we can continue our rituals. Ah.. that should please Her.

repulsionArmor.name: Repulsion Armor
repulsionArmor.pickup: After <y>6</c> hits <b>reflect incoming attacks</c> for <y>400% damage</c> and <g>increase armor</c> by <g>100</c> for <y>4 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <y>seconds</c>.
repulsionArmor.description: After <y>6</c> hits <b>reflect incoming attacks</c> for <y>400% damage</c> and <g>increase armor</c> by <g>100</c> for <y>4 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <y>seconds</c>.
repulsionArmor.story: Prototype Repulsion Armor; it doesn't quite work as advertised. The protective shielding will activate, but only after... repeated triggers. You'll have to get hit a lot of times before it activates. We have tried increasing the sensitivity, but it lead to the armor triggering from simple movements. We will send an improved prototype next month.

brilliantBehemoth.name: Brilliant Behemoth
brilliantBehemoth.pickup: All your <y>attacks explode</c> for a bonus <y>20% <c_stack>(+20% per stack) <y>TOTAL damage</c> to nearby enemies.
brilliantBehemoth.description: All your <y>attacks explode</c> for a bonus <y>20% <c_stack>(+20% per stack) <y>TOTAL damage</c> to nearby enemies.
brilliantBehemoth.destination:
Francis M
29th Ave
'Powderkeg Bar'
Old York
Mercury
brilliantBehemoth.story:
Pristine condition from the War of Slopes, 2019. All genuine and a real good collector's item! 

She still works, but I would -not- try to fire it. Requires blackpowder which is expensive enough as is, but she makes a loud bang!
Selling for $200,000 starting. Send it back or I'll have my boys over.

interstellarDeskPlant.name: Interstellar Desk Plant
interstellarDeskPlant.pickup: Upon killing an enemy, spawn an <b>alien plant</c> that heals you for <g>3% of your maximum health</c> and <b>recharges</c> after <y>4 seconds</c>. Plant lasts <y>15 <c_stsack>(+5 per stack) <y>seconds</c>.
interstellarDeskPlant.description: Upon killing an enemy, spawn an <b>alien plant</c> that heals you for <g>3% of your maximum health</c> and <b>recharges</c> after <y>4 seconds</c>. Plant lasts <y>15 <c_stsack>(+5 per stack) <y>seconds</c>.
interstellarDeskPlant.story:
FORGET ALOE VERA. THIS IS THE NEXT THING.

You know how people always have those on their desks? Well this isn't just for the cuts and burns; this makes you feel good EVERYWHERE. Vitamins, proteins, you name it, this plant got it. Takes very little time for it to bear another fruit as well, but it does require some strange potting soil... as in carcasses. Small carcasses.

ANYWAYS, shoot me an email if you are interested!

laserTurbine.name: Laser Turbine
laserTurbine.pickup: Using <b>skills</c> charges the generator by <y>7.8% <c_stack>(+7.8% per stack) <y>per second</c>. At full power, fire a laser for <y>2000% damage</c>.
laserTurbine.description: Using <b>skills</c> charges the generator by <y>7.8% <c_stack>(+7.8% per stack) <y>per second</c>. At full power, fire a laser for <y>2000% damage</c>.
laserTurbine.story: Replacement laser turbine for the photon power plant. The thing is deceptively small, but it holds immense power. Keep it away from all electromagnetic sources; it will charge from the field, and if the capacitor becomes overloaded, it WILL discharge.

wickedRing.name: Wicked Ring
wickedRing.pickup: Gain <y>5% <c_stack>(+10% per stack) <y>critical chance</c>. <y>Critical strikes</c> <b>reduce cooldowns</c> by <b>1 second</c>.
wickedRing.description: Gain <y>5% <c_stack>(+10% per stack) <y>critical chance</c>. <y>Critical strikes</c> <b>reduce cooldowns</c> by <b>1 second</c>.
wickedRing.story:
With how many rings he had, you would think more would have been found, eh? Nope, just this one. The King used to sacrifice one of his own sons to embue the ring with dark spirits. He claimed that the spirits warded away any ill omen. The King lived until he was 104, so hey, maybe he was right.

As the last remaining Wicked Ring, I expect a hefty sum.

alienHead.name: Alien Head
alienHead.pickup: Decrease your <b>skill cooldowns</c> by <b>30% <c_stack>(+30% per stack)</c>.
alienHead.description: Decrease your <b>skill cooldowns</c> by <b>30% <c_stack>(+30% per stack)</c>.
alienHead.story:
Important sign from the spirits. Passed down for many generations. Must be used for high noon ritual to ward off sickness and fatigue. Must be kept cool or will rot.
Helps energize the kinfolk and can be used for extra human strength and agility. Important.

theOlLopper: pickupEnemies take more damage at lower health.
theOlLopper.pickup: Enemies take more damage at lower health.
theOlLopper.description: Deal <y>bonus damage</c> to enemies with lower health, up to <y>+60% <c_stack>(+60% per stack) <y>damage</c>.
theOlLopper.story:
Chop! CHOP! I need SHARPER! The lopper don't lop no more! 

I go to lop and.. and the head STAYS ON! No good! Only works on weak! Neck OFF! New lopper NEEDED!

theHitList.name: The Hit List
theHitList.pickup: Randomly <b>marks up to 1 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <b>enemy</c>. Killing a <b>marked enemy</c> <y>permanently increases damage by 0.5</c>, up to <y>20 damage</c>.
theHitList.description: Randomly <b>marks up to 1 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <b>enemy</c>. Killing a <b>marked enemy</c> <y>permanently increases damage by 0.5</c>, up to <y>20 damage</c>.
theHitList.story:
Don't forget.. don't forget what they did..
-A.Bn
-Fr.Ntn
-[CLEARED]
-[CLEARED]
-Random wildlife
-[CLEARED]
-Grvnkmp
-[CLEARED]

photonJetpack.name: Photon Jetpack
photonJetpack.pickup: Hold the jump button to <b>fly</c> for up to <y>1.6 <c_stack>(+0.8 per stack) <y>seconds</c>. Recharges over <y>1.6 seconds</c>.
photonJetpack.description: Hold the jump button to <b>fly</c> for up to <y>1.6 <c_stack>(+0.8 per stack) <y>seconds</c>. Recharges over <y>1.6 seconds</c>.
photonJetpack.story: Here it is, sir. Please just be careful; I'm not quite sure what you are planning, but I don't think the jetpack lasts long enough to fly over to the other office. 77 floors is a long way to fall, sir.

shatteringJustice.name: Shattering Justice
shatteringJustice.pickup: Attacks <y>reduce enemy armor</c> by <y>6</c> for <y>2 <c_stack>(+2 per stack) <y>seconds</c>. Reduction stacks up to <y>-30 armor</c>.
shatteringJustice.description: Attacks <y>reduce enemy armor</c> by <y>6</c> for <y>2 <c_stack>(+2 per stack) <y>seconds</c>. Reduction stacks up to <y>-30 armor</c>.
shatteringJustice.story: I'm glad people still use hammers in combat; I find it much more intimate than guns. This thing weighs 5 TONS (yes, TONS), so only your Combat Equipped soldiers can use it. Five tons in a few square feet means that the hammer can crush enemy tanks, EASILY.

telescopicSight.name: Telescopic Sight
telescopicSight.pickup: <y>1% <c_stack>(+0.5% per stack) <y>chance</c> on hit to <y>instantly kill enemies</c>. <r>Does not work</c> against bosses.
telescopicSight.description: <y>1% <c_stack>(+0.5% per stack) <y>chance</c> on hit to <y>instantly kill enemies</c>. <r>Does not work</c> against bosses.
telescopicSight.story:
Can be used for both night and day shooting, and comes with infared attachments and built-in distance finder.

...And please, actually use the scope. We are all impressed you can hit a target without it, but I'm tired of watching your videos. Spinning while firing is also a great way to lose your license.

firemansBoots.name: Fireman's Boots
firemansBoots.pickup: Walking leaves behind a <r>fire trail<y> that burns for <y>35% <c_stack>(+20% per stack) <y>damage</c>.
firemansBoots.description: Walking leaves behind a <r>fire trail<y> that burns for <y>35% <c_stack>(+20% per stack) <y>damage</c>.
firemansBoots.story:
With the insane temperatures of your condition, it has come to our attention that you would probably want the strongest flame-retardent equipment. Well here it is; it works by literally 'fighting fire with fire.'

It dispenses fluids that burn at low-temperature, which consumes large amounts of oxygen. This should starve any high-burning flames nearby, but obviously will leave a flaming trail behind you. Don't use this outside of the correct conditions, or you will burn your house down.
Can be refilled with gasoline, kerosene, or really anything that burns decently.

hyperThreader.name: Hyper-Threader
hyperThreader.pickup: Hitting enemies <y>fires a laser</c> that deals <y>40% damage</c> and <y>bounces</c> to <y>2 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <y>enemies</c>.
hyperThreader.description: Hitting enemies <y>fires a laser</c> that deals <y>40% damage</c> and <y>bounces</c> to <y>2 <c_stack>(+1 per stack) <y>enemies</c>.
hyperThreader.story:
Despite its appearance, the FNA 200 'Hyper-Threader' Energy Subrifle is anything but fragile.

Using direct energy technology, the FNA 200 can fire superheated gases at a high fire rate. The FNA 200 also requires little to no charging, instead generating energy from the air around it.

diosFriend.name: Dio's Best Friend
diosFriend.pickup: Taking <r>fatal damage</c> <b>consumes this item</c> and revives you with <g>40% health</c> and <g>2 seconds of invulnerability</c>.
diosFriend.description: Taking <r>fatal damage</c> <b>consumes this item</c> and revives you with <g>40% health</c> and <g>2 seconds of invulnerability</c>.
diosFriend.story: Here you go; you can remember Dio forever with this. A cheers, to the best kitten ever born. We all love you, despite your flaws. Please stick around for a long time!

ancientScepter.name: Ancient Scepter
ancientScepter.pickup: Upgrade your <b>special skill</c>. <b>Unique to each character</c>. <c_stack>Reduces special skill cooldown by 30% per stack.</c>
ancientScepter.description: Upgrade your <b>special skill</c>. <b>Unique to each character</c>. <c_stack>Reduces special skill cooldown by 30% per stack.</c>
ancientScepter.story:
A glowing scepter, with a name engraved in the handle. I can't read what it says; I was hoping you could decipher it. It must have some magical powers; look how impressive it is! It's much better than your Lance of Legends, that's for sure.

And before you ask, yes, the handle is designed to be hard to hold. Culls the weak.

rottenBrain.name: Rotten Brain
rottenBrain.pickup: Throw a brain that bounces in place, damaging/slowing enemies for <y>6x200%.</c>
rottenBrain.description: Throw a brain that bounces in place, damaging/slowing enemies for <y>6x200%.</c>
rottenBrain.story: You really messed that up, didn't you? Dammit. The ****ing thing is bouncing, Harold. How the hell are we supposed to do ANYTHING with this? Now we will never know the truth. How - how did you even MANAGE to mess up this badly? Consider this useless hunk of grey matter your letter of termination. Keep the damn thing.

safeguardLantern.name: Safeguard Lantern
safeguardLantern.pickup: Drop a lantern for 10 seconds. <r>Fears</c> and damages enemies for <y>20% damage.</c>
safeguardLantern.description: Drop a lantern for 10 seconds. <r>Fears</c> and damages enemies for <y>20% damage.</c>
safeguardLantern.story: Protects you on the darkest nights. Don't stand too close; some claim to see terrors in the flame. Me? I just see hope.

snowglobe.name: Snowglobe
snowglobe.pickup: Summon a <b>snowstorm</c> that <b>freezes</c> monsters at a <y>50% chance/sec over 7 seconds</c>.
snowglobe.description: Summon a <b>snowstorm</c> that <b>freezes</c> monsters at a <y>50% chance/sec over 7 seconds</c>.
snowglobe.story: Here you go honey, I got you a snowglobe! Do you see what's in it? Yeah, it's based off of your favorite video game! I hope you'll love it, I put a lot of effort into it. Cheers!

explorersKey.name: Explorer's Key
explorersKey.story:
Strange artifact. Seems to be made of nano-technology, allowing it to solidify and liquify at will. I have yet to find a lock this key cannot open. Highly illegal I imagine..

Has opened traditional lock and bolt, card readers, eye scanners, dead bolts, chains, zippers, and my phone password. 
I expect a hefty sum for this, because otherwise.. well.. your guild will simply become obsolete because of one key.

foreignFruit.name: Foreign Fruit
foreignFruit.pickup: Heal yourself for <g>50% of your health</c>.
foreignFruit.description: Heal yourself for <g>50% of your health</c>.
foreignFruit.destination:
Fabien H
32nd and Pike
New Africa
Mars
foreignFruit.story:
Ya feelin down?  Then eat Fabien's Nutapple! No preservatives. No chemicals. All fruit. Tastes like an apple and a cashew; together!
Guaranteed to make you feel 50% healthier or your money back!

instantMinefield.name: Instant Minefield
instantMinefield.pickup: Drop <y>6 mines</c> at your feet, each dealing <y>400% damage</c>.
instantMinefield.description: Drop <y>6 mines</c> at your feet, each dealing <y>400% damage</c>.
instantMinefield.story:
Should help in holding choke positions without losing so many men. I know that hercules is simply held because of pride; we've blown any resources we could've mined into the stratosphere by now. 

Just simply lay it down and its smart-fire should prevent it from blowing your own legs off. Spits out about six. Realize that it takes about.. 45 seconds to reload the minelayer and about a second to arm.

jarOfSouls.name: Jar of Souls
jarOfSouls.pickup: <b>Duplicate every enemy</c> as a <b>ghost</c> to <y>fight on your side</c>. Ghosts last <b>15 seconds</c> and have <y>70% damage</c>.
jarOfSouls.description: <b>Duplicate every enemy</c> as a <b>ghost</c> to <y>fight on your side</c>. Ghosts last <b>15 seconds</c> and have <y>70% damage</c>.
jarOfSouls.story: [The recording only contains wailing and screaming. Would you like to contact authorities? Y/N]

carraraMarble.name: Carrara Marble
carraraMarble.pickup: Place a <b>marble gate</c>. <b>Teleport back</c> to the gate by activating again.
carraraMarble.description: Place a <b>marble gate</c>. <b>Teleport back</c> to the gate by activating again.
carraraMarble.story:
Carrara marble is very hard to find these days. It's been very popular since Ancient Rome; however, most deposits ran out, so a chunk of Carrara marble marks up a pretty price. I'm thinking $800,000 for the amount I'm offering. 

You can make those sculptures you've always dreamed of.

sawmerang.name: Sawmerang
sawmerang.pickup: <b>Throw</c> out a <y>sawmerang</c>, slicing enemies for <y>500% damage</c> and making them <r>bleed for 4x100% damage</c>. Boomerangs back.
sawmerang.description: <b>Throw</c> out a <y>sawmerang</c>, slicing enemies for <y>500% damage</c> and making them <r>bleed for 4x100% damage</c>. Boomerangs back.
sawmerang.story: This is one of many sawblades that I will be sending for analysis. We still haven't ID'd all the bodies from the factory accident, so its up to you to run dna tests on all the.. blood and flesh. Word of caution: it smells like rotten meat.

shatteredMirror.name: Shattered Mirror
shatteredMirror.pickup: For 15 seconds, <b>double all your abilities' damage and effects</c>.
shatteredMirror.description: For 15 seconds, <b>double all your abilities' damage and effects</c>.
shatteredMirror.story: I know you; you avoid looking at yourself. You feel disgust at your own reflection; you wish every mirror to be shattered. It is time to change. You are not alone.

disposableMissileLauncher.name: Disposable Missile Launcher
disposableMissileLauncher.pickup: Fire a swarm of <y>12 missiles</c>, dealing <y>300% damage</c> each.
disposableMissileLauncher.description: Fire a swarm of <y>12 missiles</c>, dealing <y>300% damage</c> each.
disposableMissileLauncher.story:
So here is a prototype of the disposable missile launcher you requested. The box itself is made of cardboard, which raises some safety issues but also lowers the production costs immensely. The missiles are also the dumb ones that didn't pass inspection the first time around, allowing us to fit sixteen into this!

The entire thing costs about.. $40. Make sure that you don't store them together; some of the rounds have been observed to explode by themselves.

goldPlatedBomb.name: Gold-plated Bomb
goldPlatedBomb.pickup: Use <y>50% of your gold</c> to create a bomb, dealing <y>1 damage per gold spent</c>. <y>Refund 20% of spent gold</c> on kill.
goldPlatedBomb.description: Use <y>50% of your gold</c> to create a bomb, dealing <y>1 damage per gold spent</c>. <y>Refund 20% of spent gold</c> on kill.
goldPlatedBomb.story: Yeah, so? Of course I made a bomb powered by how rich you are. Dude, what? You can't afford a bomb out of money? What are you... poor? It's JUST money.

droneRepairKit.name: Drone Repair Kit
droneRepairKit.pickup: All <b>drones</c> are repaired to <g>full health</c> and <b>empowered</c> for 8 seconds. <b>Summons a unique drone.</c>
droneRepairKit.description: All <b>drones</c> are repaired to <g>full health</c> and <b>empowered</c> for 8 seconds. <b>Summons a unique drone.</c>
droneRepairKit.story: We have learned from nature that the best relationships are the symbiotic ones; the nanodrones go and fix up all the scratches and broken pieces of the attack drones, and in return they get scrap metal to replicate. Win-win for both.

thqwib.name: Thqwib
thqwib.pickup: Release a bloom of <y>30 thqwibs</c>, detonating on impact for <y>200% damage</c>.
thqwib.description: Release a bloom of <y>30 thqwibs</c>, detonating on impact for <y>200% damage</c>.
thqwib.story:
Thqwibs naturally live in very low atmosphere, so the pressurized container is for their own safety. If released into the room, they'll die immediately, so don't.


I included approximately 30 thqwibs; despite their similar appearance to other creatures, they are naturally social, and will become depressed if left alone.

dynamitePlunger.name: Dynamite Plunger
dynamitePlunger.pickup: Hitting an enemy drops <y>dynamite</c>. Use to detonate for <y>200% damage</c>.
dynamitePlunger.description: Hitting an enemy drops <y>dynamite</c>. Use to detonate for <y>200% damage</c>.
dynamitePlunger.story:
Another one for you folks. You liked the previous shipment so much, I thought I would send you more outdated tech. When I say outdated, I MEAN outdated. This thing triggers from plunging; while it still uses microwave signals to connect between sticks of dynamite, it is otherwise the same as the classics.


Like last time, I assume you'll keep this confidential between us?

giganticAmethyst.name: Gigantic Amethyst
giganticAmethyst.destination:
Greivenkamp
5th Houston St
Prism Tower
Earth
giganticAmethyst.story: Use for focus lasers, I assume. Anyways, this is the biggest one I could find ANYWHERE. Outside of the Crown Amethyst of Venus, which I obviously can't get you, this is the best for your purposes. You'll be able to reach AMAZING quality with this; good luck!

crudelyDrawnBuddy.name: Crudely Drawn Buddy
crudelyDrawnBuddy.pickup: Blow up a decoy, attracting and <b>confusing</c> enemies for <y>8 seconds</c>. Looks just like you.
crudelyDrawnBuddy.description: Blow up a decoy, attracting and <b>confusing</c> enemies for <y>8 seconds</c>. Looks just like you.
crudelyDrawnBuddy.story:
W-what do you mean? No, no, n-no! It's SUPPOSED to look like that. Yes, with the smudge, and the.. yes. It's my /style/. If you have nothing nice to say, don't say anything at all.
It looks life-like to me. Essentially a caricature of you. Could fool anyone.

prescriptions.name: Prescriptions
prescriptions.pickup: Increase <y>damage by 30%</c> and <y>attack speed by 40%</c> for <y>8 seconds</c>.
prescriptions.description: Increase <y>damage by 30%</c> and <y>attack speed by 40%</c> for <y>8 seconds</c>.
prescriptions.story:
Are these pills legal? No. Are these pills helpful? Yes. Do pigs fly? No.

Van-Ex increases strength and muscle mass in only 24 hours! Proven by science!

Make sure to take only 2 every 8 hours, max! Otherwise you may find yourself dead!

shieldGenerator.name: Shield Generator
shieldGenerator.story: While intended for anti-artillery use, the ONI-CV117 has become wildly popular in the private sector as both a personal and automobile defense device. By protecting the user in 'hard light' that closely wraps around, shock is absorbed throughout the light, rather than by the user. However, the shield generator requires time to charge, meaning it has a short up-time. Time it wisely.

unstableWatch.name: Unstable Watch
unstableWatch.story:
Doesn't work at all..! Sometimes it keeps time fine, and sometimes it sends me for a tizzy! 
I can be watchin' (haha) it and I'll see it jump 10 seconds, sometimes 15. No matter what I do it keeps doin' it, and I have no idea why. Luck for ya!
I gotta go sit down.. feelin a bit tired..

lostDoll.name: Lost Doll
lostDoll.pickup: Sacrifice <r>25% health</c> to <y>damage</c> an enemy for <r>500% of your maximum health</c>.
lostDoll.description: Sacrifice <r>25% health</c> to <y>damage</c> an enemy for <r>500% of your maximum health</c>.
lostDoll.story:
Get this out of my house. Please. Just take it. 

Since I've received this god-forsaken thing, my husband has fallen down the stairs and broke his neck, my son got hit by a bus, and my daughter has drowned in the bathtub.
And.. oh god.. I swear it moves around the house. I've tried leaving it locked in a safe, and it will be out the next day. It wont burn. Cutting it has resulted in the amputation of both my arms.

Please..

pillagedGold.name: Pillaged Gold
pillagedGold.story:
Yar! All yer enemies be a source of swag for ye, hear me true. Open the bag, facing o'er direction cutthroats, and all the gold will beck out of their britches, and into ye hand. 

I sent this across the galactic seas fer your offer; ye'll better look in yar deepest depths for a wise trade.

captainsBrooch.name: Captain's Brooch
captainsBrooch.pickup: Call down a <b>chest</c> nearby. Chest cost is <y>doubled</c>.
captainsBrooch.description: Call down a <b>chest</c> nearby. Chest cost is <y>doubled</c>.
captainsBrooch.story:
